greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Remainder when n-th prime is divided by the number of primes not exceeding n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
formula: a(n) = prime(n) mod pi(n) = A000040(n) mod A000720(n), n > 1.
example: n = 2: pi(2) = 1, prime(2) = 3, 3 mod 1 = 0, the first term = a(2);
n = 100: pi(100) = 25, prime(100) = 541, 541 mod 25 = 16 = a(100). [corrected by _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jun 18 2018]
program: (PARI) { for (n=2, 1000, write("b065133.txt", n, " ", prime(n)%primepi(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 11 2009
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 15 2001
